page.title: 01Introduction (C)
page.content: This block includes the S.E. quarter of The City of Lancaster, bounded on the East by the M6 Motorway. Beyond this, surrounded by farmland and fells is the village of Quernmore. The narrow, steep streets of small terraced houses in the Moorlands and Primrose areas of the city contrast with the pleasantly landscaped estates of semi-detached and detached houses of Newlands & Bowerham. Apart from the Ashton Memorial, which can be seen from many miles away, other features of the urban landscape include the Victorian facade of the Moor Hospital, the Cathedral spire, the twin spires of Christ Church and the turreted buildings of St Martin's College-one of a number of educational establishments in the area. We have included details of some of the local iniatives aimed at improving ammenities and prospects in the area.
